numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Young women tend to reach out to a parent more than young men.
2. Young women tend to reach out by texting more than young men.
3. Young women tend to reach out by calling more than young men.
4. Young women tend to reach out by visiting in person more than young men.
5. The difference between young women and young men is similar for texting and calling.
6. The difference between young women and young men is much smaller for visiting in person.
7. Visiting in person requires a larger time commitment.
8. Visiting in person requires a larger resource commitment.
9. Girls are socialized to be more family-oriented.
10. Girls are socialized to be more social.
11. I wonder whether this socialization causes the gap between young men and young women.
12. I wonder how these gaps differ across different parent types.
13. A single mother is a parent type.
14. A single father is a parent type.
15. Two mothers are a parent type.
16. Two fathers are a parent type.
17. I wonder what percentage of young people reach out to immigrant parents.
18. I wonder what percentage of young people reach out to native-born parents.
19. Some young people have immigrant parents.
20. Some young people reach out to immigrant parents for social purposes.
21. Some young people reach out to immigrant parents for practical purposes.
22. Helping with taxes is a practical purpose.
23. Helping with bills written in English is a practical purpose.
24. Some immigrant parents do not know English well.
25. Some non-Western cultures are more family-oriented than Western cultures.
26. Some non-Western cultures are more community-oriented than Western cultures.
27. Some Western cultures are more individualistic than non-Western cultures.
28. My grandparents do not know English well.
29. My dad helps my grandparents with healthcare.
30. My dad helps my grandparents with taxes.
31. My dad helps my grandparents with bills.
32. My dad has done this since he was a kid.
33. My dad's family immigrated to America.
34. I have a very healthy relationship with my parents.
35. I text my parents almost every day.
36. I call my parents weekly.
37. I know some people.
38. Some people have weirder dynamics with their parents.
39. Some people who have weirder dynamics with their parents reach out to their parents much less.
40. The headline is: Gender Disparities In Young Adult Child Communication With Parents.
